description: Dive into "Serene Shores of Taketomi-cho" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Serene Shores of Taketomi-cho

places.generalDescription: Nishihama, located on Hateruma Island, is a true gem in Japan's southernmost region. Renowned for its breathtaking turquoise waters and vibrant coral reefs, this beach captivates visitors with its stunning Hateruma Blue hue. Whether you're lounging on the pristine sands or snorkeling among colorful fish and sea turtles, Nishihama offers an unforgettable experience. As night falls, the sky transforms into a celestial wonderland filled with stars and the Milky Way—perfect for stargazers!
places.name: NISHIHAMA

reviews.text: My favorite beach in all of the Ishigaki Island's. The sand was impeccable, the coral was vibrant, and there was barely anyone there! They had a nice bed and breakfast nearby but unfortunately we didn't know about it until our last day. We saw lots of sea turtles and cool fish while snorkeling. This is a must stop when visiting Ishigaki!
One of the most beautiful beaches I have been to. It's stunning to see the sea turtles. The usually hang out a bit further away from the shore, close to the walls in the ocean.

Magnifique beach with rosy sand, gentle water, and not crowded. In the morning waves were stronger and the waters cooler, while after three the waters get calm and even more enjoyable.
A bit above the beach at the entrance one can get the parasols so to stay on the beach the whole day to enjoy it.

places.address: Hateruma, Taketomi, Yaeyama District, Okinawa 907-1751, Japan

places.generalDescription: Kabira Bay, situated at the northwest corner of Ishigaki Island in Japan, is a stunning emerald blue bay with a pristine yellow-white beach and craggy islands dotting the waters. While swimming is not allowed, visitors can enjoy a glass-bottom boat tour to admire the beauty of the bay. The area is known for its fast-moving tides, so caution is advised when walking along the coast from bay to bay.

sources.snippet:
Northwestern part of Ishigaki Island 
Located in 
The emerald green sea is dotted with lush islands 
Kabira Bay
.. Travel guidebook for foreigners visiting Japan " 
Michelin Green Guide Japan
", Then

Fascinates the visitors.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

places.name: Kabira Bay

reviews.text:
A scenic spot about 30 minutes by car from the city area. Despite the bad weather, the sea was clear and clean. There are plenty of parking lots and souvenir facilities nearby, and you can also have lunch around here.
The glass boat was a content that can be enjoyed regardless of the weather.
Potentially pretty bay with very strong currents. Way too many polluting boats, too many tourists, and unbelievable amount of plastic waste mainly from Japan, but some from China.

You can enjoy the underwater scenery on a cruise ship.
You can make reservations in advance for the ship, and it operates on a short time frame.
The course is within 1 hour, and the cost is also reasonable.

places.generalDescription: Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas is a laid-back beachfront resort located on top of Fusaki Beach, offering bright rooms and cottages. The spacious resort complex provides easy access to various water sports such as snorkeling, diving, canoeing, and wind surfing. It's a family-friendly luxury resort with free accommodation for children under 6. The property features pools, 4 restaurants, an open-air bar, and aroma healing spa treatments.

sources.snippet: Just a minute's walk from Fusaki Beach, FUSAKI BEACH RESORT HOTEL & VILLAS features pools, 4 restaurants and aroma healing spa treatments. Free WiFi is available throughout the property. The resort provides yoga lessons and various marine activities, such as snorkelling and canoeing, at a surcharge.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima) - Yaeyama Islands Travel

places.name: Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas

reviews.text: Had an absolutely lovely experience here! The beach is beautiful, the pools are great (the kids' water park is amazing!), and the food is delicious. Our room was wonderful, and the service was fantastic. This spot is perfect for couples, friends, or family trips. The price is also very reasonable, especially if you book in advance. While it's not super close to the airport, they offer a free pick-up service, which is a huge plus. It can get a bit crowded during peak season, so consider visiting during the off-season for a more relaxed vibe. Overall, wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone!

A perfect resort for families with young children - and perhaps only families with young children!

If you're a couple seeking romance or a family with teenagers dreaming of thrilling adventures, this might not be your ideal destination. But if you're traveling with a toddler or baby in tow, welcome to paradise.

Do keep in mind, however, that the resort experience is designed almost entirely in Japanese. Staff were kind and tried their best, but their English was limited - and there was no English version of the hotel map or facility guides. We found ourselves frequently using a translation app or heading to the concierge to ask for help, which added a bit of extra time to everything.

That said, the staff's warmth, the quality of the food, and the family-friendly facilities made up for it. We'd happily come back - especially with our little one.

Overall lovely hotel and beautiful beach&pool!
Perfect for family get away!

Staff were all very polite and attentive (other than the one or two staff standing at entrance; no greeting no service maybe they serve only hotel shuttle?).  Otherwise, they were generally v quick to response.  We enjoyed our stay very much.

places.generalDescription: Kaiji Beach, also known as "Hoshizuna Beach," is a picturesque tree-lined beach where visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls and search for tiny star-shaped shells along the shoreline. Located about 9 minutes on foot from Kondoi Beach on the south side, this beach is famous for its unique star sand.

sources.snippet:
About 9 minutes on foot from Kondoi Beach on the south side
In the place of " 
Kaiji beach
"teeth,
" 
Hoshizuna beach
The more aliases you have, the more star sand you can find.
Is famous. Because the tide is fast 
Swimming is prohibited
.. This beach is recommended for those who want to spend a relaxing and luxurious time looking for the sand of the stars or looking at the scenery in the shade of the trees.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Healing time, popular tourist attractions and activities on Taketomi Island

sources.snippet: Slightly west of the southernmost tip of the island, Kaiji beach is famous for star sand and is popular for swimming as well as sand-sifting. The tiny white stars are actually the skeletons of tiny sea creatures (but that name isn’t so cute), and can be found by careful searching to bring good luck. If you aren’t the sand-sifting kind you can browse the sea-side stalls for little sand souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Taketomi: Bicycles, Water Buffalo and Beaches

sources.snippet: This beach, together with Hoshizuna Beach on Iriomote Island, is known for its sand which is shaped like tiny stars (although it is actually made up of the skeletons of small one-celled organisms that live among the sea grass). Though a protected beach today, little star sand remains as it was bottled and sold as souvenirs in past decades. Swimming is prohibited due to strong tidal currents.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima) - Yaeyama Islands Travel

sources.snippet: Kaiji Beach is best known for its sand which appears to be in the shape of stars. While certainly a unique sight and one which you can purchase a bottle of at local shops, this sand is actually the shell remains of tiny marine organisms called foraminifera. However, please don’t take any sand away from the beach yourself as it is forbidden.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima

sources.snippet:
Come and Find Fragments of Sun and Star~ Photo credit by Yaeyama Kaito
Kaiji Beach is also known as “the beach of sand-stars.” As the name suggests, you can find sun- and star-shaped shells along the white beach. These are not bleached coral but foram shells!. Photo credit by Yaeyama Kaito
sources.shortName: How to enjoy sightseeing in Taketomi Island - where you can feel Okinawa Time

sources.snippet:
Next to the Kondoi beach, there is Kaiji Beach which is known as “Starsand Beach” because you can find star-shaped sand there. You cannot swim in this beach since Kaiji Beach has moving tide. Data：Kaiji Beach
Address/ 〒907-1101 Taketomi, Taketomi-cho, Yaeyama-gun, Okinawa
sources.shortName: Yaeyama Islands 3Days

sources.snippet: This is a beach where you can get star-shaped sand (star sand), which is said to bring good luck. Star sand is also sold at souvenir shops, but it’s more fun to find it yourself. Let’s try to find it by pressing your palm on the sand.
sources.shortName: [Taketomijima] A must-see tourist attraction on Taketomi Island

sources.snippet: Popular tourist spots include Kondoi Beach, with its beautiful ocean and white sands, and Kaiji Beach, with its star-shaped sands.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island - Must-See, Access, Hours & Price | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Kaiji Beach

reviews.text:
This was a nice place to visit, but if you are expecting to find star sand- go pound sand because it is virtually impossible to find… plus you can't take it with you if you do find it. There is a guy who sells a small vial of star sand for ¥500.

The beach does have a cute swing for Insta pics. Overall, I would bike here again just to enjoy the views.

This beach was a lot more rocky than Kondoi beach down the road. There were some cool large hermit crabs walking around and lots of rocks that looked nice under the sun. I recommend wearing swim shoes or sandals because it was difficult to walk around barefoot.

Such a lovely beach!  In addition to the star sand, this beach has the most shade I've seen in a month of my Okinawa travels.  A few swings are hanging from trees so you can enjoy the views and relax. Swimming is not allowed here. Small shop had a table on the beach with a few items for sale (jewelry and bottles of star sand)

places.generalDescription: Taketomi Island is a picturesque destination with tranquil beaches and a delightful village adorned with red-tiled roof buildings. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling among vibrant tropical fish or embark on a hike to Mount Omoto for breathtaking views. The area also offers opportunities to explore Okinawan culture and traditions, from ancient human remains at the Yaeyama Museum to learning Okinawan dance moves at Yaema Village.

sources.snippet: Taketomi Island is a flat, tiny island with a beautiful red-roofed tiles community. The statues of Okinawa lions on the red-roofed tiles, colorful tropical flowers on the white sandy paths are feasts on your eyes and you can enjoy this unique scenery in the sways of Buffalo Vehicles, Buffalo-towing cars. Taketomi Island is the most popular island in the Yaeyama Islands because it preserves Okinawa’s traditional ambience and designated as an Important Preservation District for Groups of Traditional Buildings.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Taketomi Island, Okinawa

sources.snippet: Its villages consist of well-preserved traditional style, one-storied houses surrounded by stone walls, covered with red tiled roofs, and with hibiscus and bougainvillea flowers. The island itself is designated as an important cultural asset. And, it just off the coast of Ishigaki Island and accessible in just 10 mins of turbo jet ride.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island – at Where You Experience Ancient Okinawa

sources.snippet: Taketomi Island is a raised coral reef island with a population of about 300 people. And a circumference of 9 km, a 15-minute boat ride from Ishigaki Island, an hour’s flight from the main island of Okinawa. The whole area is a beautiful island belonging to the Iriomote-Ishigaki National Park.
sources.shortName: This is one the most beautiful beaches in the world on Taketomi Island in Okinawa!

sources.snippet: Kondoi Beach on the west coast of Taketomi Island is a natural beach with a beautiful contrast between the clear sea and white sand, and is popular as a day trip beach from Ishigaki Island. It is a recommended spot for those who want to spend a relaxing time in a paradise-like scenery.
sources.shortName: Kondoi Beach Travel Guides (Okinawa Taketomicho Taketomi)| Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet: More commonly known as Taketomi-jima in Japanese, Taketomi Island is located in the Yaeyama District situated in Okinawa Prefecture, Japan. In the Okinawan dialect, the island is called Dakidun. Taketomi Island is part of the group known as the Yaeyama Islands or the Ryukyu Islands.
sources.shortName: Heading to Taketomi Island During Summer

sources.snippet: Taketomi Island (�|�x��, Taketomijima) is an island just off the coast of Ishigaki Island and the site of a beautifully preserved, traditional Ryukyu village. As Taketomi Island is fairly small, it is often visited as a day trip from Ishigaki.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima) - Yaeyama Islands Travel

sources.snippet: Visitors to the island will see the characteristic red-tiled roofs which became emblematic of Ryukyu culture during the twentieth century and shisa, the mythological lion-like figures that stand guard on houses and buildings.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima

sources.snippet: A small island that arrives from Ishigaki Island in just 10 minutes by boat. You can enjoy the nostalgic landscape of Okinawa. The area is about 5.4km2 and the circumference is 9.2km, so it is large enough to ride a bicycle.
sources.shortName: Yaeyama Islands 3Days

sources.snippet: Three villages on the island (Nishi Village, Higashi Village, and Nakasuji Village) are registered as Important Preservation Districts for Groups of Traditional Buildings.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island - Must-See, Access, Hours & Price | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Taketomi Island

reviews.text: Very peaceful Island.about 15 minutes away from Ishigaki Island. The Island have several nice beaches.several small cafe and restaurant have there. Visitors can rent bicycles.you can spend a few hours to see everything.Good place to relax.

The island offers a wonderfully authentic look at remote life, with charming traditional homes that feel very real. It's a little worrying, though, that the entire residential area seems to be on display, raising questions about privacy. Still, a memorable visit.

The island is a paradise. Not big but is full worth a day or 2, you can visit the jungle , swim in the crystal clear waters, admire the big trees close to the shore , and see the life of the locals.  Just remember to take sun screen even if it is not a shiny day.

places.generalDescription: Kondoi Beach, located on Taketomi Island in Okinawa Prefecture, is renowned for its gentle slope and fine white sands. The emerald green waters with a shallow sandy floor make it the best beach on the island. Visitors can enjoy laying out in the sun on the large white sand beach and swimming in warm waters during high tide. However, caution is advised as strong currents and poisonous creatures like Habu Jellyfish are present from June to October.

sources.snippet: It is important to take note that beaches in Taketomi do not offer any public utilities aside from Kondoi Beach. Moreover, it is also vital to be cautious of the strong currents that may pull one out to sea. There are also poisonous creatures out in the sea that one should look out for like the Habu Jellyfish, which is a type of box jellyfish that is most common from June to October.
sources.shortName: Heading to Taketomi Island During Summer

sources.snippet: With the longest stretch of golden sand on the island, this is one of the most popular spots for summer and is often very busy. It is very close to Kaiji beach on the west side of the island. This is the only beach with public facilities and also has a lot of very friendly if quite scruffy cats (definitely a win for some).
sources.shortName: Taketomi: Bicycles, Water Buffalo and Beaches

sources.snippet: Kondoi Beach, where blue ocean waters and white clouds dazzle over white sands. Kondoi Beach is the representative beach in Yaeyama and has shallow waters, which makes for safe swimming when it comes to families with small children. As the home of one of Japan’s largest reefs, it’s also a prime location for diving.
sources.shortName: How to enjoy sightseeing in Taketomi Island - where you can feel Okinawa Time

sources.snippet: Kondoi Beach, where the crystal clear ocean waters and white sands, has shallow waters, which makes for safe swimming when it comes to families with small children. At low tide, a lustrous white sandy beach emerges when the ocean pulls away. You can also relax with many cats which are around there.
sources.shortName: Yaeyama Islands 3Days

sources.snippet: Kondoi Beach on the west coast of Taketomi Island is a natural beach with a beautiful contrast between the clear sea and white sand, and is popular as a day trip beach from Ishigaki Island. It is a recommended spot for those who want to spend a relaxing time in a paradise-like scenery.
sources.shortName: Kondoi Beach Travel Guides (Okinawa Taketomicho Taketomi)| Japan Travel by NAVITIME

sources.snippet:
Kondoi beach

is. There are also facilities such as toilets, showers, and changing rooms. Therefore, women are also safe.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Healing time, popular tourist attractions and activities on Taketomi Island

sources.snippet: It is shallow and there are no waves, so even small children can swim safely. There are also showers and toilets, so you can swim in the sea. This beach is not a coral reef, so it’s better for swimming than snorkeling.
sources.shortName: [Taketomijima] A must-see tourist attraction on Taketomi Island

sources.snippet: Along the way, you’ll be able to hit up the most popular spots, including the Taketomi Folk Craft Museum, Taketomi Village, Kaiji and Kondoi Beaches, as well as bask in the beautiful nature Taketomi has to offer.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island (Taketomijima

sources.snippet: I went to Kondoi Beach, the only swimming beach on the island. This beach is probably one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The endless expanse of pure white sand and crystal clear water.
sources.shortName: This is one the most beautiful beaches in the world on Taketomi Island in Okinawa!

sources.snippet: Popular tourist spots include Kondoi Beach, with its beautiful ocean and white sands, and Kaiji Beach, with its star-shaped sands.
sources.shortName: Taketomi Island - Must-See, Access, Hours & Price | GOOD LUCK TRIP
Taketomi Island (Taketomijima) - Yaeyama Islands Travel

places.name: Kondoi Beach

reviews.text: If you're looking for peace, beauty and serenity, this is the beach for you!  Gentle shallow waters that is crystal clear with nary a person in sight!  Clear views of nearby islands with sparkling hues of blue and green for a far as your eyes can see.  Been to many beautiful beaches all over the world and this has got to be one of the best kept secrets.  Hats off to the locals for maintaining the natural beauty of this heavenly place.
Visited in mid-June 2025. It's about a 30-minute walk from the Taketomi Island ferry terminal. The most beautiful beach I've ever seen in my life.

Beautiful beach especially at high tide. Warning though : the crows are very aggressive and stole my clothes and sunscreen! Lock your valuables up! Also keep walking to the far side - there is lots of shade under trees around the bend and 200m further.

places.generalDescription: Hoshizuna Beach is a popular destination on Iriomote Island, known for its star-shaped sand and beautiful coral formations. Visitors can easily access the beach on foot, by car, or by public transportation. The shallow waters are perfect for swimming and snorkeling during the summer months. Despite some reports of garbage washing ashore, the beach offers a relaxing atmosphere with opportunities to observe marine life and explore interesting rock formations.
places.name: Hoshizuna Beach

reviews.text: Came here during low tide on a clear day. Saw lots of blue fish by coral, without any special equipment. Star-shaped sand can be found if you look closely at the orange colored sand. It helps to dig a little, as the ones near the surface have lost its edges. Definitely a unique spot for checkout as a short stop.

Iriomote Must!!! This beach is so beautiful specially at sunset. The beach is full of star sand everywhere. Scoop up the sand& check it out. So magical! The snorkeling was also fabulous! I saw so many new fish and sea snakes. I love this beach so much, I came here twice.

Rode bikes here; plenty of parking for cars & bikes, then follow a little path between guest houses down to the beach. Turn right & you may find lots of washed up rubbish, but turn left and there are some interesting rock formations. ‘Star sand' on this beach & snorkeling when it's warmer in the very clear waters. Facilities here as well

places.address: Uehara, Taketomi, Yaeyama District, Okinawa 907-1541, Japan

places.generalDescription: Fusaki Beach, located on Ishigaki Island, is part of the Fusaki Resort Village and offers a range of ocean activities and water sports equipment rentals. The beach is open from late March to October and features a lifeguard on duty as well as anti-jellyfish nets for safety. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling tours and observe various marine creatures such as sea turtles and manta rays.

sources.snippet:
A beach facing Nagura Bay, the largest bay on Ishigaki Island
is. Fusaki Beach 
teeth
Inside "Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas" 
Although it is in
Available to non-guests
.. It is a popular tourist spot not only for locals but also for tourists.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

sources.snippet: Fusaki Beach in front of Fusaki Resort Village overlooks Iriomote Island on the other side of the island. The hotel's private beach, though,Can be used by non-guests without permission. It is nice to be able to
sources.shortName: 石垣島の絶景ビーチ30選！穴場から人気の定番ビーチまで現地在住スタッフが紹介 | 石垣島ツアーズ

places.name: Fusaki Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach with a swimming area. We brought our own blanket and towels and set up on the beach by the hotel chairs. Luckily there were a few clouds to block the sun at times.

An absolutely beautiful beach with a resort nearby. A great place to enjoy a swim in the large fenced area (free of jellyfish) or a walk along the beach or pier. Also, feel free to take advantage of the bar and seating the resort offers nearby. This beach features a spectacular view of the sunrise or sunset. Be mindful to wear flip flops on the beach as the sand is littered with crushed, sharp coral bits. Only drawback, but overall an amazing beach with beautiful views.

Below the reach of extravagant resorts such as Club Med, this private beach offers an exclusive experience for those seeking a touch of a little luxury. The tranquil atmosphere, combined with the unspoilt surroundings, provides the perfect escape for those looking to indulge in a little extravagance. It's a place where you can enjoy a peaceful retreat with a touch of first class service, making it a hidden gem for those who appreciate the finer things in life.

places.generalDescription: Hateruma is a remote Japanese island known for its sugarcane plantations, sandy beaches, and traditional minshuku lodgings. The island is located in the southeast part of Hateruma Island and offers stunning starry sky guidance and telescope observation of heavenly bodies. As Japan's southernmost point on a manned island, Hateruma provides an opportunity to see the Southern Cross, which is not visible in Honshu.

sources.snippet: There are no buses or traffic lights on the island, and you can spend a relaxing time with sugar cane fields, nature-filled beaches and old-fashioned houses. It is also called "Star Island" because you can see the perfect stars, and you can observe the Southern Cross, which you cannot see in Honshu. The sea, which boasts outstanding beauty in the Yaeyama Islands, has a unique blue color called "Hateruma Blue".
sources.shortName: Yaeyama Islands 3Days

places.name: Hateruma

reviews.text: Southernmost island of Japan. Easiest way is to take a boat from Ishigaki island. If you come during off-peak season, the boat will be subject to weather condition, so there are chances you could be stuck on the island for a night. But I would not mind. You can see the Southern Cross on the island if you stay overnight. Plus the island has some of the most beaches in Japan. Most tourists come here for just day trips.

Southernmost place in Japan you can go to! I went there a couple of weeks ago and it was absolutely beautiful.

I'm from a warm and humid climate, but this place still put me to the test, as I went in early June, which is part of the rainy season, so the humidity can be quite wild (and UV apparently, too, which I found out after getting burned). I'd recommend sunscreen even if it might rain that day and no less than a few bottles of electrolyte water.

I chose to circumnavigate most of the island on foot (I'm crazy for this), but most people rent bikes here. I recommend picking the bike unless you're ready to walk for miles. Either way, it was a beautiful walk, and there's a few cool little sites you can stop by on the island as you wish.

This is not a very touristy island IMHO. Even the local tourist advertisement stuff from my hotel on Ishigaki Island barely mentioned this island. It's mostly farming and quiet beaches. It's a 1.5 hour ferry to here, or a 1 hour version for the faster boat that may get very bumpy like it did for me.

This was one of my favorite rural experiences in Japan. When the local music came on at noon, I thought that was cool.

Expect to see lots of crows, goats, and butterflies on this island. There were literally hundreds of butterflies flying around me when I walked on some unnamed roads in the southeast part of the island. In the north, there is a territorial crow about 100m-200m south of the ferry port on the main road (guesstimate), so be careful of that one. The goats were curious and nice. A kind local farmer showed me where a turtle was hiding too.

There's also mangrove areas and beaches. The southernmost vending machine was cool too! And I was able to spot Nakamigami island from the northwest corner of Hateruma. (I thought it was Yonaguni at first)

This was one of the most memorable walks I have done in Japan.

Attached photo: view of Iriomote island from northern Hateruma.

Perfect for a day trip specially if you rent an electric bike/scooter/car.
Electric bike for ¥2,200/day was very good as some parts of the island are not flat. On the new moon in a nice weather the starry sky seems be wonderful and it is said it worth stay overnight to enjoy the sky.
Beautiful and quiet beaches, no convenience stores, few restaurants and cafes. Surrounded by sugar cane fields and empty roads.

places.generalDescription: Sukuji Beach is a hidden gem on the island, offering a kilometer-long shoreline with fine sand and clear waters. It's an ideal spot for sunbathing and leisurely dips in the shallow beach. The area is equipped with amenities like public changing rooms, showers, and restrooms for visitors' convenience. Snorkeling enthusiasts can explore the diverse marine life, including hard corals, tropical fish, sea turtles, and manta rays.

sources.snippet:
Characterized by a coastline that stretches like a large bow
is. Land (lottery) beach 
of 
The length is about 1km
.. One of Ishigaki Island's representative long beaches with a beautiful gradation of blue and emerald green
..
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: Summary of recommended beaches and activities on Ishigaki Island

places.name: Sukuji Beach

reviews.text: A small, quiet beach close to the famous Kabira Bay with stunningly clear waters. Never crowded, ideal for families with children. Free parking, showers, toilets and shop. No pushy tourist traps - just pure charm.
Water is lukewarm but it has a netted off area where it‘s safe to swim. The lifeguards are really cute, one guy caught a big box jellyfish outside the net and showed it to us.
Scenic but st low tide not even worth going in. The net to protect from stingers is then flat on the ground. Nice shaded setting.

places.generalDescription: Haimurubushi Beach is located near two large hotels on a small island in Japan. The beach offers unobscured views of the Milky Way and starlit sky, making it an ideal spot for stargazing while enjoying original cocktails and local dishes in cozy lantern-lit pods. The hotel provides a superb and relaxing atmosphere with an island vibe, offering activities like jet skiing and banana boating.
places.name: Haimurubushi Beach

reviews.text: First of all, the hotel itself is superb - just the relaxing atmosphere and it's got the “island vibe”. Almost feel like the time slows down while we're here. The beach is super shallow at certain time to the point it does not suit for swimming at all. Restricted areas for swimming as they also have activities like Jet ski, banana boat etc etc (the time for swimming as well as these activity details are all noted on their website too!). Just soooooo beautiful experience. Oh NOT FORGET TO MENTION… The night sky (star gazing) here is AMAZING…. I would just sleep here if possible, so many shooting stars too…❤️

Beautiful beach, but impossible to swim during low tide, which unfortunately was most of the time we were there.

The starry sky on a clear night is amazing!

Nice well maintained beach near the Haimurubushi Resort. There is free coffee and tea available until 4 pm, then there is a dinner and drink menu. The food is good at reasonable prices. We had pizza, salad, pasta, Thai green curry, with Orion draft beer, and all was delicious, generous portions. Staff is friendly and helpful. There are comfortable lounge chairs under umbrellas, a bathroom and showers to rinse sand off your feet.

places.address: Kohama, Taketomi, Yaeyama District, Okinawa 907-1221, Japan

places.generalDescription: Nakamoto Beach is a stunning tourist destination on the island, featuring Nishinohama where sea turtles come to spawn and Nakamoto Beach where coral reefs form large tide pools at low tide, resembling natural pools. Visitors can enjoy snorkeling in the shallow and safe natural pool during low spring tides. The beach offers a wonderful opportunity to observe various fish species while snorkeling. Additionally, there are shower facilities available by the sea, and a store nearby for convenience.
places.name: Nakamoto Beach

reviews.text: Really good snorkelling beach. Only able to snorkel during low tide and you can check it with the locals.Be careful when going snorkelling as you might enter the water from the shallow end and for that I'd recommend renting boots which I didn't rent. There are lots of fish and even nemo! And lots of coral reefs. Be aware of a type of beautiful colorful fish which might attack you....

There are toilets by the entrance,  and you can wash the sand away from your feet and gear in an outdoor faucet. There was no lifeguard in May,  though,  and there was no one swimming/snorkeling as there was a sign requesting visitors not to.

This beach is really great for snorkeling, bathing and sun bathing. A little kioskee operated by the same family that owns the bike rental provides drinks, some minor snacks, and shaved ice during summer. Swimming and snorkeling equipment can be rented here as well. A hut provides some shade and some public toilets can be found here too. Beware of the relentless sun. Also, be aware of marked differences in the shoreline due to the tidal mivement and that thus part of the beach is not accessible on dry foot during high tide.

places.address: Kuroshima, Taketomi, Yaeyama District, Okinawa 907-1311, Japan
